course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Introductory Physics
course.description: This course is for students with no physics background. It can serve as a standalone introduction to physics or as a preparatory course for students who intend to take PHYS 1112. It is not a preparatory course for PHYS 1111; students with no calculus background who plan to take General Physics should take calculus concurrently with PHYS 1101 so that they meet the prerequisites for PHYS 1112. Topics covered include heat and gases, force and motion, waves, and electricity and magnetism. Students without HKDSE qualifications may seek instructor’s approval for enrolment.
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x Physics or HKDSE 1x Physics; any PHYS courses at 1100-level or above

reviews.author: zolaj9
reviews.title: chur but good grade
reviews.comment_content:
basic dse stuff
I. Force and Motion (9 lectures)
II. Heat and Gases (5 lectures)
III. Electricity and Magnetism (5 lectures)
IV. Wave Motion (5 lectures)

quite a lot to catch up for people with no physics background, but you can have 1 A4 cheat sheet for midterm and 2 for final, which is more than enough. The cheat sheets have to be 100% hand written though, which means you cannot type them or use screenshots of lecture slides.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I skipped all lectures after the first week, Prof. Lei has a strong accent and my brain feels exhausted after trying to understand what he's saying and the content for 2 hours :P

hw questions, along with some extra exercise questions are explained during tutorials. TAs are nice and you will have sufficient time to ask them questions since tutorials typically lasts only about 30 mins.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 25%
the mean is HIGH, so make sure you don't make careless mistakes.
me: ~97%

Midterm: 25%
mean: 39.65/70
sd: 15.35
me: 57/70

Final: 50%
mean: 80.82/140
sd: 30.00
me: 115/140

letter grade: A
I expected a B+/A- because my exam marks are higher than the mean by only ~1.15 sd, so good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 hrs lecture + 1 hr tutorial per week (attendance is not taken)

1 assignment (3-7 questions) every week, no projects.

exams are manageable if you finish all the exercises on Canvas. And if you're looking to achieve higher grades, make sure to tackle the textbook questions as well.

reviews.author: engene
reviews.title: Hard course for 0 physics background students
reviews.comment_content:
- Heat and Gases
- Force and Motion
- Waves
- Electricity and Magnetism

In short, 3-year (DSE) high-school physics in 3-4 months.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor NG is a nice professor who is always willing to help his students. I admit that the class can be a bit boring at times, but one thing that stands out about him is his passion for answering students' questions. He never hesitates to take the time to explain things in a clear way that makes sense to each student, and I find that very helpful.

Also, for Mr. Patrick Lee, he is a very very good teaching staff. I really learned a lot in his tutorial class. If you are a local student, he can also explain everything clearly to you in Cantonese and you will understand the concepts much more easily.
reviews.comment_grading:
Remember to find the best way to get the good grades. Do not try to remember all the lecture and tutorial content as it never works.

SUPER HINT to get a good grade in this course: DO THE TEXTBOOK EXERCISES AS MORE AS YOU CAN. Especially when you are preparing for mid-term test and final exams. The exercises in the textbook will help you A LOT.
reviews.comment_workload:
I'd say, it's quite heavy in terms of workload.

You have a homework assignment EVERY WEEK (as I remember, maybe I'm wrong) and you have to submit it within TWO weeks. For students who do not have a background in physics, completing homework assignments with high marks in a limited time can be a challenging task. This is especially true as they are trying to keep up with the new physics lecture contents. It is important to note that while copying answers from others may seem like a quick solution, it can hinder the learning process in the long run. For students who do not have a background in physics, completing homework assignments with high marks in a limited time can be a challenging task (except you are copying answers from others, which is NOT recommended). This is especially true as they are trying to keep up with the new physics lecture contents.

reviews.author: RyanCheng
reviews.title: No physics background will be difficult
reviews.comment_content:
-Force and Motion
-Heat and Temperature
-Magnetic and Electricity
-Wave motion

Basic DSE Physics

so you can do DSE physics past paper

*If you have anything not understand please ask to professor, specially if you don't have a physics background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. NG is a nice guy who willingly addresses any questions that arise after his lectures. Throughout the lectures, he presents various experiment demonstrations to illustrate the discussed content. Additionally, he enhances the class's engagement by incorporating relevant movie clips to assess the scientific accuracy of films. This approach adds an extra layer of interest to the course.

Nonetheless, the lectures tend to be lengthy, lasting approximately 1 hour and 50 minutes. Despite the inclusion of a (5 or 10)-minute break during each session, maintaining focus throughout the entirety of the lecture can still pose a challenge.
reviews.comment_grading:
-Assignments 25%
-Midterm Exam 25%
-Final Exam 50%

---------Midterm Exam---------
-Closed-book
-covers
(Force and Motion)
(Heat and Temperature)
-One "cheat sheet" is allowed (Two pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)

---------Final Exam---------
-Closed-book
-covers
(All)
-Two "cheat sheets" are allowed (Four pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)

*If you study carefully, there won't be any problem in this 2 Exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy only have 2 assignments per week.

other times I suggest lesson preparation.

*Assignments is 25%, so please do your assignments carefully and it may save you in the end.

reviews.author: shley
reviews.comment_content: If you took IGCSE Physics in high school, then most of the contents taught would be somewhat familiar - all you need to do is refresh your memory and do more exercises from the textbook. Even though attendance was not compulsory (there were no lecture recordings provided either), I still recommend attending Dr. Ng's lectures as he explains the content very thoroughly from the basics, which is very helpful for people with zero physics background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ng is a very good Physics professor who explains every concept well. He also plays videos of scenes from movie clips to explain how the concepts we learn apply in those scenarios. You can always ask him questions in between/after class as he is very willing to answer your doubts. Emailing him after class is fine too.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm exam: 25% (written, 1 double-sided cheat sheet)
Finalterm exam: 50% (written, 2 double-sided cheat sheet)
Assignments: 25% (13 in total, can drop lowest 2)

Assignments usually consist of 5-7 questions taken from the textbook, and is posted weekly. I would say as long as you keep up with lecturers, complete your weekly assignments and attempt more questions from the textbook, you will be able to do well in this course. Also, the IA will give some Worked Examples pdfs from the textbook, and I found those really helpful for the assignments as it teaches you how to answer typical questions.

Note that there is no theory questions in the exam, it is purely calculations, so make sure to jot down all the relevant formulas in your cheat sheet. I think all the questions in the midterm and finalterm exams were extracted from the textbook, so if you practice more then you're bound to encounter at least a few similar questions in the exam!

Grading-wise, I think they were quite lenient with marks. There were some error carried forward marks.
reviews.comment_workload:
Weekly assignments. It is good to find friends to cross check your answers with!
Most of the students in this course found it difficult because a lot of content is squeezed into 3 months, so be sure you don't fall behind the lectures and attend them if you can.

reviews.author: chchaney
reviews.title: Very good course
reviews.comment_content: Meaningful content. Help with people who didn't study physics before. All the topics are not hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not very strong accent but he speaks very slow in order to make everyone follow what he is teaching. No attendance required.
reviews.comment_grading: Two homework with the lowest marks can not be counted. Therefore, it's quite easy to get about ~90% in total. The exams are not hard but you need to study hard for it if you can't really understand the topics. I get mean+half SD in the mid-term ,and mean+3/4SD in final exam. Eventually get an B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly homework only. Every homework will relate to the last two lectures. If you did all your homework seriously, you should get around mean in your exams.

reviews.author: myww
reviews.title: Supportive TA
reviews.comment_content:
Generally fun to learn if you can spend some time to understand the concepts. No need to grind for some concepts that are a bit related to the concepts afterwards at first, assigning sometime to review past concepts might be useful.

For mid-term,
- Around 2 questions is about Heat & temperature (except Ideal gas)
- All other questions are Force & motion

For exam,
- Electricity & Magnetism
- Wave Motion (Sound, Optics)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Attending tutorials is highly recommended, especially when you have a responsible teaching assistant (TA) who provides thorough explanations and prepares helpful tutorial notes.

Skipped Lectures as it' s hard to focus for 9am classes. YouTube video helps a lot tho.

It is recommended to do some preview before class to at least grasp the concept. For people without Phy Background, reading textbook or watch tons of youtube video might help.
reviews.comment_grading:
Regarding the exam cheatsheet, would be good to jot down some questions from assignment.

If you can make a good use of the cheatsheet and understand a bit what the question is asking, you could already get B-range. Grading is generous.
reviews.comment_workload:
As a student who has no Phy, Chem Background + average in math + hate to do questions, weekly assignment can be stressful during mid-term period or before exam.

Do not underestimate 4 credit courses.

reviews.author: KCW
reviews.comment_content:
CONTENT

Syllabus:
Force and motion
Heat and temperature
----------midterm exam----------
Magnetic field and electricity
Wave motion
----------final exam----------

The midterm exam only covers the first 2 topics, whereas the final exam covers all topics.

Midterm:
--> 7 long questions
--> full mark is 70
--> Time allowed 90 mins
--> 1 piece of A4 cheatsheet (2 pages) is allowed
--> closed book
Final:
--> 15 long questions
--> full mark is 150
--> Time allowed 2 hrs 45 mins
--> 2 pieces of A4 cheatsheet (4 pages) are allowed
--> closed book
Assignment:
--> 24 in total
--> Submit around 2 each week
--> Total marks for each assignment is 30
--> 3 questions in each assignment
--> Steps are needed

The topics covered are not hard, just HKDSE stuff.
Calculations are not difficult. There is no differentiation and integration.

Apart from reading the PowerPoint slides given by Dr Ng, you are also strongly recommended to read relevant topics in the reference textbook 'Physics Technology Update 4th Edition' and do its exercise.
Questions in your assignments also come from this textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Ng's teaching is fair. In every lesson, he explains the laws and fundamentals of physics by asking his teaching assistant to perform experiments for us.
Besides, he often explains physics with the aid of movie clips.

However, one lecture is quite long (1hr 50 mins). Although there is a 5 mins break in the middle of every lesson, it is still somewhat difficult to concentrate throughout the entire lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. You will likely get a C if your marks are around the mean.

Assignments: 25%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 50%

The final exam contributes the most to your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy.
All you need to do is basically finish all your assignments every week and attend the exams.
It is not a must to go to the lectures (but you better do) as no attendance will be taken.

*for your cheatsheets, you are strongly recommended to write down the equations and formulas*

reviews.title: Good Grade if You Work Hard
reviews.comment_content:
PHYS 1101 is a course for students who have no or little physics foundations.
The course goes over most of the HKDSE syllabus in one semester. For people (like me) who have 0 knowledge in physics, it is quite painful to catch up with the syllabus in such a short time. The concepts are not too difficult to understand, but when it comes to calculation it is a bit demanding.
There are two lectures each week, each lasts 1 hour and 50 minutes. The lecture is quite long so you may feel bored or sleepy (in 9 am lectures).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ng speaks at a moderate pace which everyone can hear clearly. He is very nice too. He includes some demonstration and video clips of physical principles and sometimes jokes to keep the lecture interesting.

If you want to check answers of your assignments or explore more questions, tutorials may help.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 25%
Midterm:25%
Final: 50%

The questions are quite straightforward in both midterm and final, and are selected from textbook questions.
2 A4 cheat sheets (both sides) are allowed

For reference, I got full marks in assignments.
My midterm: 55/70 ( Mean: 38 UQ:51 )
My final: 104/140 ( Mean: 80.82 Median: 82 )
Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Moderate workload for me. There is one assignment per week, and you can drop two assignments with the lowest grade once you hand in all assignments in time. Usually there are 5-6 questions, but some are tricky.
I attend 75% of the lectures, and often self-learn the materials from youtube and the textbook. You have to discover the calculation steps and methods by yourselves in the textbook examples or other questions instead of just reading the lecture notes. I spend like 8 hours per week on physics for revision, solving textbook questions and assignments. A bit painful to catch up at the start of semester, but when you get used to the pace and understand more concepts you may feel better.

reviews.author: boil
reviews.title: Good course if you have taken A-level physics, textbook is important.
reviews.comment_content:
The course is equivalent to DSE physics - a sizeable amount of chapters but not much depth in each.

Students with A-level physics will find the course very manageable. I hadn't studied physics for 2 years but still did well even though I did not attend/watch a single lecture or tutorial.

I preferred to study the content by just reading the slides and watching youtube videos if I didn't understand anything

Textbook is very useful as it includes worked examples and basically all the exam questions are from the end of chapter questions from the textbook. Tutorial and homework questions are good for practice.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I didn't attend any lecture or tutorial so I can't say much but from speaking to my classmates, I heard the professors teaching isn't very good.

Finding another source to learn the material outside of lecture is definitely recommended. I personally just read the ppt and grind a lot of questions since I learned most of the things before.

The Instructional Assistant and TA's are top-notch. Reply quickly, seem passionate, and some may even give comments and encouragements when they mark your homework.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework:
- Most are around 50+/60 but if you want to get the top grades, you should be getting full marks for all.
- Answers can probably be found online if you try hard enough

Midterm
Mean: 40/70
SD: 15.35
My score: 61

Final
Mean: 80/140
SD: 30
My score: 133/140

My grade: A+

One cheat sheet allowed in midterm, two allowed in finals.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework every week (3-6 textbook questions normally). Depending how much I focus, some took me 3 hours while some took me almost one whole day. Answers can be found online but it's good to try your best to understand the logic if possible. Overall, workload is not that that bad compared to other math/phys course.

reviews.author: kooooooo sir
reviews.comment_content:
Content:
1. Force & Motion
  - Position and movement (Kinematics)
  - Force and motion (Dynamics)
  - Projectile motion
  - Work, energy, and power
  - Momentum
  - Uniform circular motion

2. Heat & Gases
  - Temperature, heat, and internal energy
  - Transfer processes
  - Change of state
  - Gases

3. Electricity & Magnetism
  - Electrostatics
  - Circuits and domestic electricity
  - Electromagnetism

4. Wave Motion
  - Nature and properties of waves
  - Light
  - Sound





GRADING

Assignments 25%

Midterm Exam 25%
-Closed-book
-One cheat sheet is allowed (Two pages, A4 size)

Final Exam 50%
-Closed-book
-Two cheat sheets are allowed (Four pages, A4 size)
reviews.comment_teaching:
TEACHING

Prof Ng is very nice, but each lecture contains two hours, and at 9 am

Tutorial sessions: The TA explains the homework or the examples in the book. Not very useful since you can read them by yourself
reviews.comment_grading: If you pass, the course will at least give you a B range. However, you need to very carefully to get an A range since the exam is easy for some people.
reviews.comment_workload:
WORKLOAD
3 questions for 1 lecture around 6 questions per week depending on the topic.Some of them are difficult but you can search on the interest so that is ok.Overall the workload is not too high.

reviews.author: Lakshya
reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment_content:
See others

Pretty much the high school physics compiled into one course done in like 2 and a half months. (yes its a lot)
reviews.comment_teaching:
I went to like 3 lectures in total so I don't really know how his teaching is.
But from what I can recall he did teach pretty well in those 3 lectures and he was willing to help with questions during the break within the lectures.

But, the lectures are 1 hr 50 mins and it is hard to maintain focus especially because prof Ng's classes were at 9 am.
reviews.comment_grading:
Bell curve grading
Assignments and Mid-Term Exam (25% each)
Final Exam (50%)

2 of your worst assignments can be dropped as long as you have done all the assignments

mean for assignments are really high because everyone uses the answer scheme so just do that as well or else you are at a disadvantage ( MAKE SURE U GET FULL MARKS IN THEM)
(I got full in all assignments except 2 so I think those 2 should drop)

mean for mid-term: 39.65/70
SD: 15.35
me: 58/70

mean for final: 80/140
SD: 30
me: 125/140

Grade: A

I think the grades given out are pretty good and the instructors will try to ensure no one fails the course. Getting B-range shouldn't be hard but A range would require effort and time put into the course.

I think the A+ range is extremely narrow and to achieve it, one would need to do good in both mid-terms and finals. However, if you mess up mid-terms, remember you always have finals which counts for half your grade so you could still achieve an A.

Oh yeah also you can bring one cheat sheet in mid-term and 2 in finals
reviews.comment_workload:
This course is supposedly for those who have 0 background knowledge in physics. Despite this, I was one of the very few people who ACTUALLY HAD 0 PHYSICS BACKGROUND.

For someone who is genuinely doing physics for the first time, this course will look very intimidating and has a fair amount of workload.
(Not the assignments but the studying)

The first month and half of this course I didn't even know what I was doing but a week before mid term i decided to give 2 whole days just to physics and I somehow clutched with more than an SD above mean as my results. Then didn't go to lectures or study anything after mid terms either so I was very far behind and then once again, this time I gave 4 days or so for finals and yeah. So I think just try using other resources such as the organic chemistry tutor and honestly you will understand everything.

trust me the course is doable and worst case scenario, just make a really good cheat sheet though I barely used them in the exams

reviews.author: quitUHelps
reviews.comment_content: Basic DSE physics, covers Force and Motion, Heat and Gases, Electricity and Magnetism, and Wave Motion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ng's teaching is quite good. He will play some movie clips to enlighten the classroom. However, It maybe difficult for student to understand the content at the first time. You may need to review and ask question afterwards.

The tutorial section is a must go. The TAs really helps you clear concepts. It review that week's assignment and lectures with simplified notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%
- Allow you to exclude two assignment for counting

The exam paper (both mid-term and final) are specate to level 1 and level 2, where level 1 is easier and test basic concepts.


Midterm Exam 25%
- Closed-book
- One cheat sheet is allowed (two pages, A4 size)
- total of 10 questions
- 1 hour 30 mins
Mean: 39.65/70
SD: 15.32

Final Exam 50%
- Closed-book
- Two handwritten cheat sheets are allowed (Four pages, A4 size)
- total of 18 questions
Mean: 80.82/140
SD: 30
reviews.comment_workload:
A total of 13 assignments, on weekly-basis, the first two (week 1 and 2) don't need to submit. Basically, 11 asm in total.

Each assignment around 6 questions, some may less to 4, and some may more to 7.

The workload maybe high for students who don't have physics background.

reviews.author: chromylchloride
reviews.comment_content: HKDSE Physics, check other reviews for topics that are extended/cut
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ng's teaching is ok I guess, I have nothing to add about it.
For Prof. Lei, his mainlander accent is too heavy for me, I can barely understand what he is talking about.

The tutorial sessions are just TA explaining the assignment questions, not very helpful for me to be honest. Later in the semester they started to provide more exercises for us to do, but they are just from the textbook so still not very useful

But I can tell the teaching team put efforts and care, so they get a B :p
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment (25%): Two lowest-score assignments can be dropped if you have handed in all assignments. Note that the mean for each assignments are quite high, likely because lots of people have the pdf of textbook exercises answer.

Midterm (25%): Harder than previous semesters. One page of written cheatsheet is allowed
Total Mark = 70
Mean = 39.65
SD = 15.35
Median = 41
Final (50%): Two pages of written cheatsheet are allowed
Total Mark = 140 (100%)
Mean = 80.82 (57.73%)
SD = 30.00 (21.43%)
Median = 82 (58.57%)

To survive in this course you just need to do as much textbook exercises as you can, that's it
The exams should be easy to deal with, the questions are still taken from the textbook, and TAs mark the exam quite leniently.

Assignment: 99% i think, too lazy to recalculate
Midterm: 51/70
Final: 129/140
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: 1 Assignment per week, the questions are from the textbook

reviews.author: Dyka
reviews.comment_content:
開sem 前大家可以攞dse physics force and motion 既書預習，基本上成本書全考除咗gravity。
其他Topic 喺呢度一係被大大簡化，一係被延伸，前者既例子有Electricity，後者有kinetic theory。

溫書方法係做曬成本書既題目佢，考試只係喺入面抽題目出黎再改數值，非常容易遇到見過既題目
reviews.comment_teaching:
NG Yee Fai: 幾好，鐘意上佢既堂

Lei Shiming: 太重大陸口音，而且多甩咳。

TA: 冇去Tutorial
reviews.comment_grading:
改卷Step 分鬆手
Midterm (25%):
Me: 67/70
Mean: 39.3/70
Median: 41
High: 68  
UQ: 51
LQ: 25.75

Final (50%):
Me: 135/140
Mean: 77.19/140
Median: 78.
High: 135    
UQ: 102.25

Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: 每一個禮拜一份Assignment

reviews.author: nuclear-c0w
reviews.comment_content:
DSE Physics (excluding Elective part, see attachment)
You'll need to take this course if you didn't take Physics in DSE.

Attendance is not compulsory.
No recordings are provided but do enable all email notifications on Canvas.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ng's lectures are fine. Clear accent. Movie clips and live demoes are included in the lectures to make them more interesting. I skipped all the lectures after midterm since I'd come to the realization that they were useless (also it's 9 am lectures, ain't no way I can focus for 2 hours in the morning). You're better off using online resources such as Khan Academy/The Organic Chemistry Tutor.
Professor Lei has a Putonghua accent. Go to the other lecture if you don't like it.

Do attend the tutorials though. The tutors will review concepts taught during lectures and assignments. Extra questions are included after midterm since people were asking for them.

Helpdesks are available so go there if you find the assignments difficult. Patrick (Tutor/Course Admin) arranged helpdesk sessions right before finals. It was very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% : Assignments
25% : Midterm (one double-sided cheat sheet)
50% : Finals (two double-sided cheat sheet)

You should get all 25% for the assignments since you can literally discuss it with your friends or just look at the solution pdf.

See attachments for histogram.
Midterm statistics:
Full: 70
Mean: 39.1, SD: ~15.35
LQ: 25, Median: 41, UQ: 51
Low: 0, High: 68

Finals statistics:
Full: 140
Mean: 77.19, SD: ~30
LQ: 55, Median: 78.5, UQ: 102.25
Low: 0, High: 135

My score:
Asm: 627/630 (i think lowest 2 was dropped but not all asms have the same full marks?)
MT: 45/70
Finals: 122/140
A-, so i'll give Grading an A
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload was fine (Magnetism was a bit tough though). There is 1 assignment every week (13 in total). The first 2 are not graded.

All the questions (asm & exams) you'll face are taken from the reference textbook (at least for 2022 & this semester) so do go and download them from Library Genesis (or check Issac Lam's review). If you really wanna aim for the best you can do all the questions in the book.

Also read the chapters and the summaries as you can copy a lot of the equations from there. The slides weren't enough imo.

reviews.author: NTR
reviews.comment_content:
DSE Physics:
Force
Heat
Electricity and magnetism
Wave
Not very hard but needs effort, especially EM(Using concept of vector cross product to imagine makes it simpler.)
The exam questions all come from the text book level 1 and 2 questions; if you drill lots of book questions, you will find the same in the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: I skipped half of the class since lectures are all at 9 a.m. but Prof. NG 's teaching was not bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
Unknown
Curve grading
reviews.comment_workload: There are 13 assignments in total, every week do one, and assignments 1 and 2 won't be graded.

reviews.author: WhiteMonobloc
reviews.comment_content:
TL;DR: Syllabus of HKDSE Physics

I. Force and Motion
II. Heat and Gases
III. Electricity and Magnetism
IV. Wave Motion
reviews.comment_teaching:
TL;DR: Both are fine but Prof. NG is recommended. But actually, why attending lectures if YouTube could do a better job?

Prof. NG is experienced in teaching the course and did a pretty good job. His English is fluent and the lectures are easy to follow. He also loves to demonstrate physical phenomena through TV dramas and films, which makes the lectures not too boring.

On the other hand, Prof. LEI is a new member of the school. Having a strong Putonghua accent, his English is quite difficult to understand. He also talk off-topic things very often.

Nevertheless, both professors are willing to help and answer questions after lectures or through emails. So both are fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mediocre.
Assignments(25%), two assignments with lowest marks would not count
Midterm(25%), 1 cheatsheet allowed
Final(50%), 2 cheatsheets allowed
reviews.comment_workload:
Mentally demanding.
4 hours lecture as well as assignments that take you 2 hours to complete every week.

reviews.author: ThomasYip1
reviews.comment_content:
Force and Motion
Heat and Gases
Electricity and Magnetism
Wave Motion
HKDSE Physics Level
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr Ng is a great instructor and also Practric Li. The tutorial and the lecture are great for absorbing new knowledge. Can ask many questions after tutorial lessons, good for people with Cantonese as their mother language.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is fine so far, the full marks in midterm are 70 marks and the mean is around 3x marks.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is large, every week has assignments about what have taught at that week.

reviews.author: kelvinJJ
reviews.comment_content:
Force and Motion
Heat and Gases
Electricity and Magnetism
Wave Motion
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr NG is very nice and good at teaching but I think 2 hours lecture is too long for me.
Tutorial: TA will explain the assignment in tutorial session and I think it is very important for you to understand the concept.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is fair. The mean of the midterm is around 40 out of 70.
reviews.comment_workload: I think the wokload of the course is large. You have to submit assigment every week. There is around 6 question in one assignment.

reviews.author: dc_u64
reviews.title: Difficult for those who did not have any prior Physics knowledge
reviews.comment_content:
1) Force
2) Heat
3) Electricity and magnetism
4) Wave

Those are basic concepts in Physics while the calculation does not require calculus, so it is friendly to those who did not have learnt it. However, it is difficult for those who did not have any prior Physics knowledge because the progress is really fast.
reviews.comment_teaching: He has the passion in teaching the course, for he will talk about interesting things out of the syllabus, but he often stutters which may be a little distracting. No attendance is taken, and interesting demonstrations are performed in the lecture theater. There is a textbook adopted, but it is optional because assignment questions are extracted and posted.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments --- 25%
Midterm Exam - 25%
Final Exam ----- 50%

The average scores of assignments are quite high, about 50 / 60.
One cheat sheet is allowed in the midterm, and two in the final. Formulae can be written on it.
reviews.comment_workload:
One assignment per week, 4-6 questions per assignment.
After the submission deadline, the answer will be posted and the subsequent tutorial session will discuss the assignment. By the way, no attendance is taken for the tutorial too.

reviews.author: sheeeeeeeeeeep
reviews.comment_content:
Heat and Gases
Force and Motion
Waves
Electricity and Magnetism
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ng explains physics concepts in detail, taking the time to explain fundamental formulas rather than simply relying on the PowerPoint slides. In each lesson, the TAs conduct small physics experiments that make the class more engaging and interesting.

Attending tutorials is crucial if you struggle to understand something from the lectures. The TAs are friendly and willing to answer your questions and provide explanations.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term: 25%
The mid-term exam is closed book, and you are allowed to have one A4 cheat sheet (two pages). Personally, I copied the textbook summaries onto the cheat sheet along with some important formulas.

Final exam: 50%
The final exam is closed book, and you are allowed to have two A4 cheat sheets (totaling four pages).

Assignments: 25%
Assignments make up 25% of the overall grade. Remember to submit on time.
reviews.comment_workload:
As it is a 4 credit course, you are required to submit 1 to 2 assignments every week. Remember to double-check and ensure that you use the correct units. The TAs may deduct marks if the units are missing.

~~~~
My opinion:
Personally, I struggled to learn a lot of physics in a short amount of time. However, I worked hard by doing exercises and asking the TAs for help with my questions and understanding. In the end, I got an A- in the course. Even if you're not great at math or physics, with effort, you can still get a good result in this course.^_^🌟

reviews.author: marvellous
reviews.title: 對無phys 底嘅會比較難
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus:
1.Force and motion
2.Heat and temperature
3.Magnetic field and electricity
4.Wave motion

the syllabus is very similar to DSE syllbus, so watching DSE phys video will help a lot.
Recommended channel:
https://www.youtube.com/@MarcYam
reviews.comment_teaching:
very nice teacher likes to make fun
do experiments during the lecture to help you understand better
The Lecture is 1hr 50 mins . Although we are given a 5-minute break, it is still a challenge to concentrate.
reviews.comment_grading:
24 Assignments in total (25% in total)
Mid-term(25%)  --->one cheat sheet is allowed(A4 size)
Final(50%).        ---> two cheat sheet are allowed(A4 size)

I think he gives quite good grades and would try to pull everyone up to B -range
個人無phys底 Final： A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fine
complete every assignment every week which will only be around 3-4 questions and will also be counted toward the final grade.

***I strongly recommend buying the textbook(E-book is fine) because the questions that appear in the exam are mostly likely coming from the textbook( same question)
***for the cheat sheet, I suggest you write all the formulas on the paper

reviews.author: Wit Lee
reviews.comment_content:
I. Force and Motion (9 Lectures)
   - Position and movement (Kinematics)
   - Force and motion (Dynamics)
   - Projectile motion
   - Work, energy, and power
   - Momentum
   - Uniform circular motion
II. Heat and Gases (5 Lectures)
    - Temperature, heat, and internal energy
    - Transfer processes
    - Change of state
    - Gases
III. Electricity and Magnetism (5 Lectures)
    - Electrostatics
    - Circuits and domestic electricity
    - Electromagnetism
IV. Wave Motion (5 Lectures)
    - Nature and properties of waves
    - Light
    - Sound
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Ng is a really nice person, the pace of the lecture was well-controlled by him. There was film shown to student which is for demonstrating the physics in the film and experiment when the lecture was near to the end.He would give a lot of esay example to explain the compilcated physics in order to let us understand the lecture more easily.  There was a break in every lecture and student can feel free to seek the help of professor Ng. He may try his best to allow u to understand the physics question u asked.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading for me is OKAY. I got 80% marks in both my mid term exam and final exam. Most of my assignment is about full mark.(most  of student got full marks actually)The final grading of me is an A
Weigh Percentage:(according to my bad memory)
Assignment 25%
mid-term 25%
final exam 50%
reviews.comment_workload: It's about two assignment per week which related to the lecture. Each of them was about 3 question. If u were understand the lecture, it wouldn't take much of ur time. The course is for people who didn't studied dse physics before. If u are concentrated enough during the lecture, I think the content won't really be ur burden.

reviews.author: Sin.t
reviews.comment_content:
almost all the core part of dse physics
the most interesting part is that there are always experiment demonstrations during lesson.

Momentum

If ask them questions, they could teach you until the next session of the classroom
they would draw the graph immediately and discuss with you so really can feel their passion in making you understand.
but it is also true that the lessons are so boring
it is ok if you skip all and only study ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
fair

but SD quite high, thirty something in final exam
me (really can't remember)

final: high than mean for around 30 marks (>80%)
final grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
fair
2 asm a week, total about 5-6 questions
one mid-term
final
that's all

reviews.author: jellycat
reviews.comment_content:
1.Force and Motion
2.Heat and Gases
3.Electricity and Magnetism
4.Wave Motion
Midterm:one cheat sheet is allowed
Final:two cheat sheet is allowed
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ng is very nice and passionate about teaching physic.The lecture is close to lunchtime, so he allow us to eat during lesson. In most of the lecture, he will let TA to perform some experiments which make us feel less boring and get to know the concept better.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is nice
25% for midterm
50% for final
25% for assignment (there are 24 assigments, assignments during add drop period will not be counted, the lowest two assignments will be excluded.)
reviews.comment_workload: For no physic background, the workload is high, as the course will teach a bunch of new concepts in a short period of time,which is very intense. I suggest you can take a look at the lecture note before lesson. If you still don’t get the concept, you can ask professors or watch online YouTube videos.Beside, make sure you finish all the textbooks exercise, it is super useful.Some of the questions will even appear in the exam.

reviews.author: bryanlb
reviews.comment_content:
No MC question for all
Introduction to physics course
Hard for new learning physics personal

Midterm:
allowed 1 A4 cheatsheet (2 pages)
closed book

Final:
allowed 2 A4 cheatsheet (4 pages)
closed book
reviews.comment_teaching:
Some time will have a small physics experiment in class to show.
prof. are funny but TA are boring
One drawback is that the classes are quite lengthy (110 minutes each). Even though we had a short break of 5 minutes after every class, it was hard to stay focused for the whole duration of the lecture.
TA are so hea Just follow PowerPoint
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 25%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 50%
reviews.comment_workload:
So far so good, every after-class still has homework.
every weekend 1-2 assignments

reviews.author: iLOVEhkustttttt
reviews.title: Free PDF files here!!
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus:
Force and motion
Heat and temperature
----------midterm exam----------
Magnetic field and electricity
Wave motion
----------final exam----------

The midterm exam only covers the first 2 topics, whereas the final exam covers all topics.

Midterm:
--> 7 long questions
--> full mark is 70
--> Time allowed 90 mins
--> 1 piece of A4 cheatsheet (2 pages) is allowed
--> closed book
Final:
--> 15 long questions
--> full mark is 150
--> Time allowed 2 hrs 45 mins
--> 2 pieces of A4 cheatsheet (4 pages) are allowed
--> closed book
Assignment:
--> 24 in total
--> Submit around 2 each week
--> Total marks for each assignment is 30
--> 3 questions in each assignment
--> Steps are needed

The topics covered are not hard, just HKDSE stuff.
Calculations are not difficult. There is no differentiation and integration.

Apart from reading the PowerPoint slides given by Dr Ng, you are also strongly recommended to read relevant topics in the reference textbook 'Physics Technology Update 4th Edition' and do its exercise.
Questions in your assignments also come from this textbook.

Textbook pdf file:
https://acrobat.adobe.com/link/review?uri=urn:aaid:scds:US:38c72efa-9974-30ab-ae01-77cea78815f5

Textbook questions solution pdf file:
https://acrobat.adobe.com/link/review?uri=urn:aaid:scds:US:8dec0b41-e3a9-3c84-8af3-01e2e6a9f731
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Ng's teaching is fair. In every lesson, he explains the laws and fundamentals of physics by asking his teaching assistant to perform experiments for us.
Besides, he often explains physics with the aid of movie clips.

However, one lecture is quite long (1hr 50 mins). Although there is a 5 mins break in the middle of every lesson, it is still somewhat difficult to concentrate throughout the entire lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair. You will likely get a B if your marks are around the mean.

Assignments: 25%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 50%

The final exam contributes the most to your grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy.
All you need to do is basically finish all your assignments every week and attend the exams.
It is not a must to go to the lectures (but you better do) as no attendance will be taken.

*for your cheatsheets, you are strongly recommended to write down the equations and formulas*

reviews.author: Flying P
reviews.comment_content:
Lectures
1) Force and Motion (9 lectures)
2) Heat and Gases (5 Lectures)
3) Electricity and Magnetism (5 Lectures)
4) Wave Motion (5 Lectures)

Basic things in DSE Physics

every week have Tutorial  discuss the assignment and review the content taught in lectures
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr NG is a nice guy, after the lecture he willing to answer the questions that you raised.

During the lecture there are different experiment demonstrations to explain the content that told.

Also, He use some movie clip to explain is the film scientific correct. I think this make the class more interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 25%
Mid term Exam 25%
-Closed-book
-One "cheat sheet" is allowed (Two pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)
Final Exam 50%
-Closed-book
-Two "cheat sheets" are allowed (Four pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)
reviews.comment_workload:
-Each assignment have 3 questions.
-2 assignments per week
-Assignment/exam solutions and selected worked examples in the adopted textbook will be discussed at tutorials.
-TWO lowest-score assignments (in comparison with other submitted ones) will be dropped, i.e., NOT counted towards the final grade.

If you pay attention during the class you will know how to do the assignments.

Just like practices after lectures.

reviews.author: palak
reviews.comment_content: Not having any prior knowledge about physics, the content was considerably a lot.  There isn't any attendance requirement for this course, for the lecture or the tutorials.
reviews.comment_teaching: I attended a few lectures, they were lengthy and got quite boring from time to time. However, the professor is great and you can understand if you pay attention.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading I believe was okay, the assignments saved my grade overall.  The assignments and the midterm have the same weighting(25%), and the final has a 50% weighting
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is acceptable, every weekend 1-2 assignments were due, which weren't too time consuming

reviews.author: Harlez
reviews.comment_content:
Content is relatively basic and easy to understand covering topics such as:
Force and motion
Heat and gases
Electricty and Magnetism
Wave motion.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor mostly just followed the ppt, however he also included some demonstrations during the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was fine and the tests were relatively easy since the professor allowed cheat sheets.

Midterm:
Full marks are 70, mean 38.62, max 70, min 4 (0 for absence), and std 18.77
My mark: 70/70

Final:
Full marks are 139, mean 84.3, max 137, min 6 (0 for absence), and std 31.9
My mark: 131/139

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments a week that includes 3~ish questions. So the workload was pretty light. There were also some worked examples that you can do which the TA covers in the tutorials.

reviews.author: Manki0v0
reviews.title: DSE Physics basically
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to highschool DSE physics syllabus but easier.
Covers various topics:
Force and Motion
Heat and gases
electromagnetism
Wave Motion
It's comparatively easier than dse one cuz no paper 2 electives and raidioactivity stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ng is very nice, he would listen to students' requests like using cheat sheets in mid-term and final. Sometimes he will adjust the syllabus to make them easier to understand
reviews.comment_grading:
assignment 25%
mid-term 25%
final 50%
For both midterm and final, you are required to answer around 10 questions.
Calculators are permitted.
1 cheat sheet(2 pages) for mid-term
2 cheat sheets for final exam
I copied down various commonly seen question type and formulas which turned out to be handy during the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments per week with around 5 short questions, mostly utilizing the formulas taught during lectures

reviews.author: Zane
reviews.title: Good Grade!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Very simple physics content, not too difficult, no need to come and listen if you have learned physics before (unless you want a very good grade)

Content:
1. Force & Motion
  - Position and movement (Kinematics)
  - Force and motion (Dynamics)
  - Projectile motion
  - Work, energy, and power
  - Momentum
  - Uniform circular motion

2. Heat & Gases
  - Temperature, heat, and internal energy
  - Transfer processes
  - Change of state
  - Gases

3. Electricity & Magnetism
  - Electrostatics
  - Circuits and domestic electricity
  - Electromagnetism

4. Wave Motion
  - Nature and properties of waves
  - Light
  - Sound
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course is really long, 2 and a half hours a session
It's hard to concentrate for long periods of time, especially when the content isn't always engaging
reviews.comment_grading:
25% of assignments
I get full marks for most of my assignments

25% for mid-term
70/70 can have cheat sheet

50% at the end of the term
118/125 can have a cheat sheet

I got an A in the end, which was not too difficult overall
There is still some difficulty in getting an A+ (the exam needs to be infinitely close to a perfect score)
reviews.comment_workload:
The homework for a lesson is basically 5 application problems, which can be done relatively quickly after the lesson
Of course there will be some content that you will need to study online (very little)

It takes a long time to do the cheat sheet before the exam, but it is also a good revision process

reviews.author: Jenny暮雨
reviews.comment_content: The content is far more than I expected, and we also include magnetism, which might be a little tricky. But the difficulty is suited for a student who abandoned physics in grade 10.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style is well. One thing is that the professor will stop providing recordings to students after add and drop period. And compared to reading PowerPoint, I prefer to attend lectures to help me comprehend.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was good. You can undoubtedly get an A range if you understand the contents.
reviews.comment_workload: Two assignments a week correspond to the two lectures. （It takes me some time sicne I'm not good at physics.)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures: The Prof teach things at a proper pace and include experiments, but it's quite boring. Youtube would probably be better if you want to understand

Tutorial: The TA would just explain the assignments and teach the assignments from the book

Practice worked examples, assignments, past papers.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%
Midterm 25%
Final 50%
Graded by a curve
Mid-term: 1 Cheat sheet is allowed
Finals: 2 Cheat sheet is allowed
This means you can print out examples with answers, and formulas, for the exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week there is 2 assignments with at least 3 questions

Buy the book (Physics Technology Update) would probably be better as there are more examples some of the mid-term and finals questions are from the book

reviews.author: CMchan
reviews.comment_content:
I. Force and motion (9 lectures)
II. Heat and Gases (5 lectures)
III. Electricity and Magnetism (5 lectures)
IV. Wave Motion (5 lectures)
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ng is very friendly, he is willing to answer students' questions. Every time I send an email to him, he replies me immediately.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Assignment
25% Midterm
50% Final exam

Me:
Assignment: one 9.5/10, others 10/10
Midterm:67/70
Final:130/139
Total:~95%
Grade:A+

2 assignments per week
But if you want to get a good grade, you should do all the worked examples in textbook.(I pay lots of efforts in the midterm and the final.)

reviews.author: Q_L
reviews.title: Speedrunning DSE Physics in 4 months
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the DSE stuff (compulsory part)

Textbook Adopted:
- Physics--Technology Update

Content:
1. Force & Motion
  - Position and movement (Kinematics)
  - Force and motion (Dynamics)
  - Projectile motion
  - Work, energy, and power
  - Momentum
  - Uniform circular motion

2. Heat & Gases
  - Temperature, heat, and internal energy
  - Transfer processes
  - Change of state
  - Gases

3. Electricity & Magnetism
  - Electrostatics
  - Circuits and domestic electricity
  - Electromagnetism

4. Wave Motion
  - Nature and properties of waves
  - Light
  - Sound
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Ng is very nice, but each lecture contain two hours so it is difficult for me to stay focus.

Tutorial sessions: TA just explain the homework or the examples in the book. Not very useful since you can read them by yourself
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments 25%

Midterm Exam 25%
-Closed-book
-One cheat sheet is allowed (Two pages, A4 size)
Mean: 38.62/70
SD: 18.77
Me: 56/70

Final Exam 50%
-Closed-book
-Two cheat sheets are allowed (Four pages, A4 size)
Mean: 84.3/139
SD: 31.9
Me: 126/139

I think the exam questions are quite straightforward and most of them are easier than the DSE level. The grading is Fair if you work hard.
(Update: I heard that the exam paper is more difficult now, probably because 22-23 Fall is the first semester of this course)

My grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Overall, I think the workload is high since I have don't have much knowledge in physics.
I spent some time to study after each lecture and ask for my friend's help. It took me some time to understand the concept.
Each week have two assignments (three questions in each assignment).
Besides doing the exercises in the book, I also suggest you to do those DSE or CE questions before the exam

reviews.author: betabass
reviews.comment_content:
1. Position and movement (Kinematics)
2. Force and motion (Dynamics)
3. Projectile motion
4. Work, energy, and power
5. Momentum
6. Uniform circular motion
7. Temperature, heat, and internal energy
8. Transfer processes
9. Change of state
10. Gases
11. Electrostatics
12. Circuits and domestic electricity
13. Electromagnetism
14. Nature and properties of waves
15. Light
16. Sound
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's teaching is clear, just that he could speak a little bit faster. He is very passionate about physics and wants us to learn the most of it. He's always willing to answer every students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
22 Assignments worth 10 marks each (max:220) 25%:
Similar questions come out from the textbook which was recommended by this course, so try the textbook questions.
Max: N/A
Mean: N/A
SD: N/A
Me: 216/220

Midterm (max:70) 25%:
All writing questions, so make sure that you are confident with every step.
1 cheat sheet allowed.
Max: 70
Mean: 38.62
SD: 18.77
Me: 69/70

Final (max:139) 50%
Similar to midterm, but around twice the length, twice the time.
2 cheat sheets allowed.
Max: 137
Mean: 84.3
SD: 31.9
Me:133/139

Result: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very light for a 4-credit course. Every week there are around 5-6 questions that takes less than an hour to get them done. Just make sure that your answers show workings and explanation.

Also, the exams marks are pretty generous (e.g. error carry forward)

reviews.author: mading18
reviews.title: Get ready to speedrun physics in 5 months
reviews.comment_content:
Part 1: Forces and Motion (9 lectures)
Part 2: Temperature and Gases (5 lectures)
Part 3: Electricity and Magnetism (5 lectures)
Part 4: Sound and Light Waves (5 lectures)
Pretty much the curriculum of most high school physics courses like in DSE, IB, AP, etc but condensed into a single semester. Some label this as "General Physics 1 With Calculus but without the calculus"; I can't really agree but content still isn't the easiest
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Ng is okay at teaching; he teaches the content well and has a decent sense of humor but his lectures could get boring over the 2 hours. He does include live demonstrations that the TA's help with in every lecture to teach the content better

TA's answer questions when asked during tutorial sessions as well as go over worked examples and previous week assignments during tutorial sessions
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterms 25%
Assignments 25%
Finals 50%
Assignments are pretty easy if you understand the content taught.
Midterms and Finals, if you already know some basic physics concepts or you study a lot, are really easy. But I do understand that people who take this course enroll in this course with absolutely no knowledge about physics and may struggle a bit.

My scores:
Assignments: Mostly 10/10's or 9/10's
Midterms: 70/70
Finals: 133/139
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload despite assignments every week

You do have to do 2 assignments per week, but they are literally just 2-3 questions per assignment(just allocate 20 minutes to do the assignments a day after the lecture and you'll be fine there)

Whether or not you buy the textbook is completely your choice.
I must say however, that just doing assignments and worked examples would not be sufficient in this course to do well in exams. The content they give you apart from the textbook is simply not enough. Furthermore, like 70% of the questions from the finals were the medium difficulty questions in the chapter review sections of the textbook

You're allowed to write your own "data sheets" so no need to memorize formulas for this course; one A4 sized sheet for midterms, two for finals.

reviews.author: TC6535531
reviews.comment_content:
forces and motion (position and movement, force and motion, projectile motion, work, energy and power, momentum, uniform circular motion)
heat and gases (temperature, heat, and internal energy, transfer processes, change of state, gases)
electricity and magnetism (electrostatics, circuits and domestic electricity, electromagnetism)
wave motion (nature and properties waves, light, sound)
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ng is funny. Also it has some experiments operated by the TA during class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25% (20 assignments + 2 bonus)
Midterm Exam 25% (covering forces and motion, heat and gases)
Final Exam 50% (covering all the topics)
reviews.comment_workload: you will have 2 assignments every week, each assignment contains 2-3 questions.

reviews.author: lovesonlyu
reviews.comment_content:
Just the compulsory part of DSE Physics with less content.
1. Force & Motion
2. Heat & Gases
3. Electricity & Magnetism
4. Wave Motion

If you won't study physics after this course, actually you don't really need to understand the abstract concept especially those in E&M. You can still answer the questions correctly.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I only attend 2 lectures and tutorials because of three reasons.

1. Teaching is quite boring. Professor mainly repeats the content on the ppt.
2. The air-cons in LT-B are very cold.
3. TA who is responsible for the experiment in the lecture has a terrible accent and I am not sure about what he is doing. Also, I learn nothing from his tutorial. It is just going through the book exercises and assignments that I can do the same at home.

Reading textbooks may help you more than attending lectures. It may only take about 30 minutes for you to finish the content but a lecture last for 2 hours.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 25%
Mid-term: 25% (max:70 mean:38.62 std:18.77)
Final: 50% (max:137 mean:84.3 std:31.9)

Me:
Assignment: 25/25
Mid-term: 60/70 (higher than mean by 1.1std)
Final: 102/139 (higher than mean by 0.55std)
Grade: A-

The grade is fair. You can still receive a lot of partial credits even if your answer is incorrect. I thought I can only get 45 in mid-term but the final outcome is 60.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 2 assignments per week that can be finished in half an hour.
As long as you are able to finish them by yourself and do revision before the exam, you can get a satisfactory grade.
Not heavy for a 4-credits course.
However you should put more time in this course because it is a 4-credits course.

reviews.author: Acceleratoru
reviews.comment_content:
I forces and motion
II heat and gases
III electricity and magnetism
IV wave motion
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Ng is very humorous, the experiments at the end of lectures are very fun and funny. However sometimes I get a bit confused while he was explaining some concepts, to be honest I believe the textbook "Physics Technology Update" is more helpful than the teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: out of 10 marks each. Full marks for all assignments except one got 9.5/10
Midterm - 68/70. Mean 38.62, max 70, min 4, std 18.77.
Final - 124/139. mean 84.3, max 137, min 6 (0 for absence), and std 31.9
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: 24 assignments. Each assignment consists of 3 questions. Takes about 30min - 1hr to finish.

reviews.author: Leoml
reviews.comment_content:
The course is easy, much easier than dse physics. 4 aspects of physics are covered: 1.force and motion 2.heat and gases, 3. Electricity and magnetism 4. Wave motion
Full syllabus can be found in other reviews.
Somehow better than phys1112 and others since exam is long question.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Ng uploads the lecture slides on canvas before lecture and present it during lectures, his accent is great. However the examples given on class is not enough. So boring, but he had tried his best.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%, midterm 25%, final 50%
Graded on a curve, shouldn't be too bad if you worked hard.
The mean of midterm is 39/70, final is 84/139
I got 62/70 and 132/139 in midterm and final respectively.
Total: ~91%
Grade: A?? (Seems the cut off is quite high for A+)
reviews.comment_workload: Light. 2 assignments per week, the workload is just right for a 4 credit course. But I prefer more exercises.

reviews.author: 哈HA
reviews.comment_content:
I. Force and Motion (9 Lectures)
Il. Heat and Gases (5 Lectures)
Ill. Electricity and Magnetism (5 Lectures)
IV. Wave Motions (5 Lectures)
Each Week: TWO 1 hour and 50 minutes lecture + ONE 50 minutes tutorial (No attendance is recorded)
*Detail of course syllabus and assignment timetable is attached
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fai Jai has delivered the class in a moderate pace, with explaining the concepts with examples in an interesting way. Also, there are some experiment demonstrations during the lecture.
At tutorial sessions, TA would explain the assignment question (the week after the submission of the assignment), and sometimes explain the worked examples on textbook.
Overall, the teaching of this course is easy to understand.
*No recording in revision (?)
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 25%
Midterm Exam 25%
Final Exam 50%

Grading: Unknown🙏🏻 (Because I do not take the mid-term examination and final examination)
------------------------------------------
In mid-term examination and final examination:
* One "cheat sheet" is allowed (Two pages, A4 size; handwritten, printed, with drawings)
* Physical constants, typical values, prefixes, unit conversion formulae, etc. will be provided in the exam questions
Question Type: No MCQ; Short questions and long questions [Structured questions] => Examination would be similar
reviews.comment_workload:
Weekly assignment required:
Around 2 assignments per week; Each assignment has 3 questions
The assignment is hand-written
